SENT.plain: The best surgical treatment for ruptured dissecting aneurysms of the vertebral artery is still controversial
Four patients (1 male, 3 female), age ranging from 43 to 62, were operated upon in our department during the last 6 years
Duration from rupture to the operation was 0 to 4 days
In 2 cases, proximal clipping was the primary treatment, while 2 had a trapping
Antiplatelet agents were given to prevent vasospasm in all cases postoperatively
In proximal clipping cases, one patient had suffered from fatal rerupture on the sixth postoperative day
In trapping cases, Wallenberg syndrome developed in one patient

These results suggest that a proximal clipping may not allow the treatment for the vasospasm because of the danger of rebleeding and also a trapped segment of vertebral artery should be as short as possible to avoid compromised perforators
